abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.help: ABSTRACT: The proposal abstract should clearly communicate the proposal’s objectives, relevance, expected outcomes, and potential impact, serving as a high-level overview of the proposal's essential points. It should include key elements such as the research question, background context, hypothesis, methodology, and anticipated results. The abstract should be succinct yet detailed enough to convey the essence of the proposal, highlighting its innovation and relevance to the field. The text should be a maximum of 250 words.

addProposal.label: Add Proposal
addProposal.toolTip: Click to add a new proposal.
addProposal.warning: Please wait whilst we create a new proposal

addTarget.label: Add Target
addTarget.toolTip: Will add the target to the list associated with the proposal

arrayConfiguration.label: Array Configuration
arrayConfiguration.help: Specify an array a configuration. Currently the SKA has two arrays which is the MID and LOW.

bandWidth.help: Select the desired bandwidth in MHz (LOW) or GHz (MID) for your proposal. You can also specify a custom bandwidth by selecting the custom option
bandWidth.label: Band Width

centralFrequency.help: CENTRAL FREQUENCY:Specify a central frequency which should be within the selected band and fully contained within the bandwidth.
centralFrequency.label: Central Frequency

changeProposal.content1: You are about to change the type of your proposal.
changeProposal.content2: Some data specific to the proposal type may be lost.

email.label: Email
email.help: The email is a requied field and must be provided. The investigator will be invited to participate in this proposal using this email so please ensure it is correct.

listOfTargets.toolTip: A list of target will be entered and/or imported from file

name.label: Name
name.help: Name of the target/object. If you want to automatically populate the coordinates then provide a name of a known object and hit the resolve button to query SIMBAD first and NED if not found. However, you can provide an abitrary target/object name which can contain any charater and enter the coordinate values.

proposalType.label: Proposal Types
proposalType.help1: Below are the available Proposal Types.
proposalType.help2: A description of the different types is provided on 'hover' as an aid as to the correct type of proposal to be selected
proposalType.help4: It is possible to change proposal type at a later date, however be aware that this may cause information already entered to be lost

rightAscension.help: Right ascension HELP: RA can be in hours, minutes, and seconds, where 24 hours represents a full 360-degree rotation. For example, '+33:55:00.00'.  RA can also be in degrees in which case you have to select the appropriate unit.
rightAscension.label: Right ascension

scienceCategory.label: Science Category
scienceCategory.help: Select a category that best describes the science of your proposal.

scienceSubCategory.label: Scientific sub-category
scienceSubCategory.help: SUB-CATEGORY: Select a sub-category that best describes your proposal.

1.value: Right Ascension: RA can be in hours, minutes, and seconds, where 24 hours represents a full 360-degree rotation. For example, '+33:55:00.00'.  RA can also be in degrees in which case you have to select the appropriate unit.

2.value: DECLINATION: This field takes the declination of a target in a string format 'DD:MM:SS.S' or in degrees. Declinations below 5 degrees cannot be observed for MID observations and below 10 degrees for LOW observations.

sensitivityCalculatorResults.errorUnknown: The error is undetermined at this time

specialCharacters.invalid: Invalid input: only alphanumeric characters, spaces, and some special characters are allowed
specialCharacters.email: Please enter a valid email address.

spectralAveraging.help: Spectral averaging involves taking multiple spectra and averaging them to enhance the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR). Consider this value as it reduces random noise and enhances the true signal, making it easier to detect and analyze spectral features.
spectralAveraging.label: Spectral Averaging

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

spectralResolution.help: High spectral resolution allows you to Identify and separate closely spaced spectral lines, Analyze fine details in the composition, temperature, and velocity of your targets/objects, Detect subtle shifts in wavelength due to Doppler effects or chemical composition changes.
spectralResolution.label: Spectral Resolution
